gate.groovy
Class GateGroovyMethods

java.lang.Object
  gate.groovy.GateGroovyMethods

public class GateGroovyMethods
extends Object

Class containing static methods that will be mixed in to several core GATE classes when the Groovy plugin is loaded, making the methods available as instance methods on their respective types (in the same way as Groovy does by default for DefaultGroovyMethods).

Method Detail

collect

public static List collect(Corpus self,
                           groovy.lang.Closure closure)
Call the closure once for each document in this corpus, loading and unloading documents as appropriate in the case of a persistent corpus, and collecting the return values of each call into a list.

Parameters:
self - the corpus to traverse
closure - the closure to call
Returns:
a list of the return values from each closure call.

collect

public static Collection collect(Corpus self,
                                 Collection coll,
                                 groovy.lang.Closure closure)
Call the closure once for each document in this corpus, loading and unloading documents as appropriate in the case of a persistent corpus, and adding the return values of each call to the given collection.

Parameters:
self - the corpus to traverse
closure - the closure to call
Returns:
a list of the return values from each closure call.

eachWithIndex

public static Object eachWithIndex(Corpus self,
                                   groovy.lang.Closure closure)
Call the closure once for each document in this corpus, loading and unloading documents as appropriate in the case of a persistent corpus. The closure will receive two parameters, the document and its Integer index in the corpus.

Parameters:
self - the corpus to traverse
closure - the closure to call
Returns:
the corpus.

getAt

public static AnnotationSet getAt(AnnotationSet self,
                                  groovy.lang.Range range)
Sub-range access for annotation sets (mapping to getContained). Allows someAnnotationSet[15..20]. This works with ranges whose end points are any numeric type, so as well as using integer literals you can do someAnnotationSet[ann.start()..ann.end()] (as start and end return Long).

See Also:
AnnotationSet.getContained(Long, Long)

getAt

public static DocumentContent getAt(DocumentContent self,
                                    groovy.lang.Range range)
Sub-range access for document content. Allows documentContent[15..20]. This works with ranges whose end points are any numeric type, so as well as using integer literals you can do documentContent[ann.start()..ann.end()] (as start and end return Long).

Parameters:
self -
range -
Returns:

getAt

public static AnnotationSet getAt(SimpleAnnotationSet self,
                                  String type)
Array-style access for annotation sets. Allows things like someAnnotationSet["Token"]

See Also:
SimpleAnnotationSet.get(String)

getAt

public static AnnotationSet getAt(SimpleAnnotationSet self,
                                  List<String> types)
Array-style access for annotation sets. Allows someAnnotationSet["Token", "SpaceToken"]

See Also:
SimpleAnnotationSet.get(Set)

withResource

public static Object withResource(Resource self,
                                  groovy.lang.Closure closure)
Call the given closure passing this resource as a parameter, and ensuring that the resource is deleted when the closure returns. This would typically be used in this kind of construction: 
 Factory.newDocument(someUrl).withResource {
   // do something with the document (it)
 }

Parameters:
self -
closure -
Returns:
the value returned from the closure
